txt.en: 'Thank you, [placeholder], for cooking and storing the meats you have gathered. These rations should last us for some time.'

'If you have a moment, I must discuss something with you. Our provisions have begun to run low. We must not let hunger be the end of this expedition. I need anyone who is able to hunt the beasts that roam Dor Amarth. Lômazar has assured me that the dire-horns are edible and the sûlokil are rather good when cooked and seasoned.'
Placed the cooked meats in a crate for curing
Ingold can be found at the Ruins of Díngarth.\n\nYou should speak with Ingold.
Black goats and sûlokil can be found sparsely populating the plains and hills of Dor Amarth.\n\nYou should gather meats from these beasts to help feed the conquest into Mordor.
Ingold worries that provisions will run out during the expedition into Mordor and asks you to acquire meats in Dor Amarth for him.
You should cook the raw meat at one of the burning fires nearby the Ruins of Díngarth.
Store the cooked meats for Ingold
You should bring the cooked meats back to the Ruins of Díngarth and store them away.
Black goats and sûlokil can be found sparsely populating the plains and hills of Dor Amarth.\n\nYou should gather meats from these beasts to help feed the conquest into Mordor.
